snippet: The area around 126th Street and Park Avenue still resembles a giant, beat-up storage shed.
abstract: Area around 126th Street and Park Avenue in Harlem remains an uninhabited eyesore, despite years of promises for development; five vacant lots on the block were recently purchased for a total of $1.35 million, raising hopes of some residents for change, but area's zoning continues to restrict property to automotive and heavy commercial uses.
lead_paragraph: The area around 126th Street and Park Avenue still resembles a giant, beat-up storage shed.

headline.seo: Harlem Redevelopment Skipped 126th Street and Park Avenue
headline.main: Sign of Change on a Block Skipped, Until Now, by Harlem’s Rebirth
headline.print_headline: Sign of Change on a Block Skipped, Until Now, by Harlem’s Rebirth
